# invalidate()

**Instance Method**

Stops a running session.

## Declaration

```swift
func invalidate()
```

## Discussion

When an app calls this function, NI invokes [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didRemove:reason:)] on the peer’s side and passes in the `reason` [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NINearbyObject/RemovalReason/peerEnded]. The app can’t restart invalid sessions.

## Managing life cycle

- **delegate**: An object that the framework notifies of session events.
- **pause()**: Stops sending distance and direction updates to the peer.
